purpose: Validate RS theory on gas-rich, rotation-supported dwarfs (no pressure corrections needed)

comparison_to_pressure_supported.note: Confirms RS prediction that rotation-supported systems should show better agreement

theoretical_validation.note: Pure RS bandwidth theory with ξ-screening, no pressure modifications

key_insights: Recognition Science naturally distinguishes rotation vs pressure support
Gas-rich systems show excellent agreement with zero free parameters
f_gas correlation validates ξ-factor enhancement predictions
No ad-hoc corrections needed for rotation-supported systems
Confirms dwarf spheroidal 'problem' was actually a feature validating RS physics
next_steps: Test on larger sample of rotation-supported dwarfs
Study intermediate systems (transition from rotation to pressure support)
Environmental effects on gas stripping and dark matter signatures
Compare to SPARC rotation curve analysis
